citeinfo.title: planning.GIS.ava_Napa_County
citeinfo.othercit: Viticultural definitions were downloaded off the internet to get the exact determination for the boundaries.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.2 (Build 3790) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

descript.abstract: Napa Valley American Viticultural Areas (Sub-AVA's) Polygons showing the area in Napa County that are part of the Napa Valley American Viticulture Areas.
descript.purpose: To graphically show Viticultural Areas in Napa County

idinfo.accconst: None. Data is available from the County of Napa by registering at website: http://gis.napa.ca.gov/giscatalog/catalog.asp
idinfo.useconst: Disclaimer: This GIS data is intended to provide a visual display of data for the user's convenience. Users of this data are hereby notified that the appropriate public primary information sources should be consulted for verification of the information. Although every reasonable effort has been made to assure the accuracy of this data, the County of Napa makes no warranty, representation or guaranty as to the content, sequence, accuracy, timeliness or completeness of any of the data provided herein and explicitly disclaims any representations and warranties, including, without limitation, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. The County of Napa assumes no liability for any errors, omissions, or inaccuracies in the information provided regardless of how caused and assumes no liability for any decisions made or actions taken or not taken by the user of the data in reliance upon any information or data furnished hereunder. Because the GIS data provided is not warranted to be up-to-date, the user should check with the County staff for updated information.

citeinfo.title: Wine Institute on American Viticultural Areas

procstep.procdesc: Richard Mendelson brought in the proposed Calistoga boundary definitions. Remaining AVA definitions downloaded off http://www.iwineinstitute.com/. Diamond Mountain and Oak Knoll districts could not be found here and found them on another website. The USGS basemaps are used to digitize these boundaries. Calistoga is still proposed.
Digitized in Proposed Tulocay AVA district.
Checked http://www.iwineinstitute.com/ for updates to AVA's or if the proposed Calistoga or Tulocay boundaries were approved yet. No updates, don't see Calistoga or Tulocay approved.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

prcStep.stepDesc: Added recently approved Coombsville AVA using boundary description from TTB. Also revised Wild Horse Valley and Oak Knoll District boundaries based on boundary descriptions from TTB. Removed proposed Tulocay AVA boundary since it approximates the approved Coombsville AVA boundary and was withdrawn by TTB on 6/19/2008.
prcStep.stepRat: Edited AVA feature class to reflect recent AVA approval, to clean up adjacent boundaries, and to remove outdated AVA info (i.e. Tulocay)
